title: Who is Josh Tucker in Coronation Street and what did he do to David?
text:
David has been through the mill on Corrie, and Josh Tucker is one of the biggest culprits… (Picture: ITV)

Poor David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) has been through the mill on Coronation Street, and it’s not set to get any easier for the poor guy.

Not only is he in prison, but he’s also about to come face to face with Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton) again, who’s serving time behind bars too.

With a prison riot about to provide an opportunity for David to take revenge on his worst victimiser, here’s what you need to know about what Josh did to David.

Who is Josh Tucker in Coronation Street?

Josh previously worked as a mechanic at Webster’s and befriended David when the latter signed up for a charity boxing match that Josh helped organise.

The pair grew close, but Josh showed his true and vicious colours when, on a night out, he spiked David’s drink and raped him.

This ordeal rocked David to his core, and it took him quite some time to come to terms with what had been done to him, with Josh insisting that they had shared a consensual encounter.

Josh never admitted to raping David, and David eventually snapped and forcibly drove him to an alleyway demanding that Josh confesses to the authorities.

With Josh (who became blind after another of his intended victims gave him a beating) convinced that they were at the police station, he begged for David to let him go, saying that he wouldn’t be able to cope with prison life, that he would be put on a sex offenders register and be known as a rapist.

This proved enough of a confession for David, and he left Josh in that alleyway.

In upcoming scenes, David will see his rapist once again as he lays eyes Josh in the medical wing of the prison hospital, getting treatment for what looks like multiple injuries.

Later in his cell, Abe will tell David that Josh is in jail because he drugged and raped someone else.

This will lead David to admit that not only did Josh do the same to him, but that he wants to deal with Josh alone.

When a riot breaks out at the prison, and Abe delivers Josh to his cell along with a pair of scissors, David will be presented with a tough decision.

Will he take revenge on his attacker, or will he be the bigger man?
